intro: Lecythis chartacea var. calyce, commonly known as the Amazonian cupuaçu, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces a distinctive, cup-shaped fruit that contains a rich, creamy pulp. The plant belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is valued for its edible seeds and nutritional content. Its bark and leaves have also been used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits. The tree plays an important ecological role in supporting biodiversity within its native habitat.
